--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, German Viscuso <netquake@s...> wrote:
> Dear Derek:
> 
> I would like to know what xml format for networks nevt supports.
> Is it the supported spec somewhere on 
http://nevt.sourceforge.net/  ?
> Is it the same as the latest proposed xml spec for NEAT available 
in yahoo
> groups?

Nope...it's a little different.  There's a user guide available on 
the NEVT website, which is also included in the .zip distribution.  
It should be able to walk you through using the package.

When you unzip it, you'll find four directories:

/complexity
/fitness
/network
/species

These correspond to the four types of graphical output that NEVT 
produces.  Each directory contains the style sheet, DTD, and a sample 
XML file.  Just look at the XML file and DTD for the type of 
graphical output you want to produce and make sure your XML conforms.

Hopefully over the next few months, with some feedback, we can settle 
on good standard formats for the XML output.  Even if they're 
slightly different, it is fairly simple to convert one XML format to 
another with XSL, and I don't mind helping people out with this.

> Thank you for nevt!

No problem.

I know some people are reluctant to have to deal with new 
technologies, but there's not a lot that needs to be learned to use 
these tools.  We were just trying to create a good, platform-
independent set of graphing tools to keep others from having to spend 
time and energy coding that stuff for their implementations.

Derek
